q: rivals, said: " Eric Schmidt has been at it for a decade, a very long time to be running a company, particularly one that has very headstrong founders in key positions of power." I think it's fair to say that Larry Page will not be a conventional CEO-- he's not been much of a public figure for the past 10 years, John Battelle added on his blog, Battellemedia.com. "It will be interesting to see if that changes, or if Page chafes at the relentless public demands of running a massively scrutinized public company."

," Eric Schmidt said in a prepared statement. "By clarifying our individual roles we'll create clearer responsibility and accountability at the top of the company." Twitter comment on the shuffle was less formal: Day-to-day adult supervision no longer needed!, he wrote. The surprise move shocked the tech industry.
